intro: Henckelia incana, commonly known as the woolly henckelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Henckelia incana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
